intro: Agrimonia noguchii, commonly known as the Japanese agrimony, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of Korea. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Agrimonia noguchii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
